thinking.disposable_income: South Main residents have relatively high disposable income with a median household income above Houston's average, as it includes affluent areas near Rice University and the Medical Center.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: The area has high discretionary spending capacity with residents frequently patronizing upscale retail, dining, and entertainment establishments along Main Street and Rice Village.
thinking.accessibility: The area has excellent transit accessibility with multiple light rail stations, bus routes, and proximity to major employment centers, while also having good road infrastructure for driving.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1) Given high income levels, residents can absorb higher taxes/fees while benefiting from improved transit; 2) Many residents use both transit and driving, so balanced improvements to both modes are valuable; 3) The Medical Center location means reliable transit access is crucial; 4) Higher driver fees can help reduce congestion around major institutions; 5) Proposals with moderate-to-high taxes and fees that yield significant travel time improvements are preferred; 6) Lower transit fares are less critical given income levels
